description:
Craig isn’t on TV, billboards or on the side of a bus.Instead, he devotes his time and resources to helping his clients.For almost 30 years, he has helped countless victims of automobile accidents and medical mistakes just ask his clients.He will not charge you unless he wins your case so there is no risk in contacting him.

Craig and his firm pride themselves in their ability to obtain a prompt and fair recovery for their clients in a competent, compassionate and committed manner.His goal is to remove the burden of the legal process from his clients so they can focus on recovering from their injuries.

Craig and his team will leave no stone unturned and spare no cost to obtain the best result possible.Making sure that every client is well informed as to the progress of their case and feel as comfortable as possible during the process is very important to him.Communication not only provides peace of mind, but also helps secure success.

His record of success has gained him widespread recognition.He has been named by the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette as one of the area’s best lawyers in medical malpractice.He has also been named a “Super Lawyer” multiple times, has a “Superb” rating on AVVO and is AV Pre-eminent peer-review related, the highest rating conferred to lawyers by Martindale-Hubbell.In addition, in 2018, the National Academy of Personal Injury Lawyers included him on its top 10 Personal Injury Attorneys List for Pennsylvania.

Craig is an adjunct law professor at his alma mater, The University of Pittsburgh School of Law, where he teaches a litigation strategy class.While he belongs to numerous organizations, he is privileged to currently serve on the Board of Governors for the Academy of Trial Lawyers of Allegheny County, a select trial lawyer organization, which is limited in number and is by invitation only.

Based in Pittsburgh, Craig has been fortunate to represent clients in an estimated 40 plus out of Pennsylvania’s 67 counties.He has appeared in Court in virtually every geographical area of the Commonwealth.He will come to your home, wherever it is located, to meet with you to discuss your case.
